Posts.Content: Hi Ann , I finished last Tuesday and am exhausted this weekend.  I have worked through my radiotherapy. They did say it might get worse before it gets better and symptoms last for 2to 3 Weeks after. I also think you concentrate on getting through it and when it's finished you physically and emotionally go phew ! I am keen to get back to the gym but am going to start just swimming. Here's to normal energy levels by next year !
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy fatigue?

Posts.Content: The article is really helpful , thank you.  I have been quite hard on myself as I haven't had chemo just lumpectomy , radiotherapy and Tamoxifen.  I have been really positive, now treatment has finished , I feel rubbish, the article really recognises that . Thanks again x
Posts.Title: Can’t stop worrying

Posts.Content: I know how you feel . Everyone else is happy there is no spread and radiotherapy is finished .I am not so much worried it will come back, I just don't feel happy it's weird . I have just started some counselling, I hadn't realised how angry I was at the randomness when I have done everything to keep fit , eat well etc and other people who have done nothing don't get it ! Keep going , this forum is great to realise so many people feel the same. X
Posts.Title: Can’t stop worrying

Posts.Content: You are definitely not a drama queen. The worst part is the waiting . Whatever the result you will deal with it. My lump was found on a family history mammogram. Wait for results , op to remove cancerous lump and lymph nodes then wait for results 6 week wait for radiotherapy has turned in to 12 week wait . It is all about the waiting !!!whatever results are stay strong you'll get through it .
Posts.Title: "Suspected Breast Cancer"

Posts.Content: You are definitely not alone in feeling like you do . A colleague who had breast cancer 15 years ago told me afterwards would be the worst bit. I finished radiotherapy November.  I spent the whole time feeling positive and grateful that my lumps were found through family history screening and I would not need chemo . I am having counselling and am back at the gym however my confidence is rock bottom and I feel permanently anxious . We will all get there is am sure it will just take time .I saw a quote ' I didn't survive cancer to die of stress ' ! Very true x
Posts.Title: Once treatment has finished..getting back “to normal “

Posts.Content: It seems having a milestone birthday and holiday plans is pretty common! I was diagnosed a few weeks after my 50th birthday in June. I was going away to see my son be best man that week. Like the others have said everyone's journey and feelings are different.  I have had lumps and lymph nodes removed and start radiotherapy on 30th and am taking Tamoxifen.  I have not cried at all as I am so relieved it was found , not spread so no need for chemo. I am sure it will hit me at some point. Keep talking and get through in chunks, look for the positives , I have been overwhelmed by people's support .Keep your sense of humour too.My boob has been nicknamed Smurf as it has a blue circle from the radioactive dye and now folds over like a Smurf hat Good luck
Posts.Title: Diagnised today.......feel a bit lost!

Posts.Content: Hi Lizzie. I have been taking Tamoxifen for 2 months. The first few weeks were the worst . When I wasn't having hot flushes I was nauseous, it was like being pregnant and menopausal at the same time ! That has settled now . It is still causing havoc with my periods being anything from 5 weeks to 2 weeks apart. I am in the last week of radiotherapy, when I saw the nurse she said it usually takes 4 months for the Tamoxifen symptoms to truly settle.  So keep going , hang on in there and hopefully you will feel better soon.
Posts.Title: tamoxifen problems
